column11: Review Text

Lovely clean sandy beach, great for long walks and to watch the sunset. Barberyn Reef is just near by for a relaxing swim. You will find many great fresh seafood restaurants along the way and they are cheap.
Nice beach. Mostly empty not much crowd unless its a holiday. Good place to relax or go swimming. Close to many hotels

The beach was relaxed, not too crowded, spacious and the views and sunset were nice. It was pretty wavey but fun to swim in, also saw many beginner surfers there. During our 7 day stay the water was clean except from one day. There were a few surf schools, couple of restaurants and bars and overall relaxed feeling. For fun and nightlife it doesn't have too many options.

We did the river tour from the end of Moragalla Beach with Susith, he was very knowledgable and did a hassle free tour.  He showed us crocodile’s, water monitors, white frog, bats, kingfisher and much more.  He took us down the small river and the large river, nothing was too much trouble.  I would recommend his tour, if you require a tour WhatsApp him on 0774421411 or ask for him at the Bentota River end of the beach.
Enjoyed a good walk here in the early evening sunset. Very busy as a natonal holiday, but full of life so good to see
The beach is flat and nice. However, it is close to the river which brings substantial waste water. Much prefer Bentota one.

Moragalla beach is located just opposite the Bentota panhandle at the estuary of Bentota River. A picturesque and relatively secluded beach. Can get here from Aluthgama or Beruwala. Recommended. Protect and conserve.
We like this beach. very nice wew.safety swiming. Good sea food restaurant. Have good fun with your family.....

This beach is good for walking if staying nearby - if they clean it up. Not good for swimming, rough sea. There is a pool like place at the far end, but water is murky. Go elsewhere for the beach experience, if you can.

A lovely quiet beach with plenty of sun beds and perfect for relaxing. There is a good choice of restaurants serving excellent food.  This was the most relaxing beach area we visited during our stay in Sri Lanka.

The beach only has small areas from which it is safe to swim and the sand gets very hot so best to have flip flops on. There are some shops with items on sale that are good value for money. The beach bars are definitely worth a visit whatever your favourite tipple is. Generally, it is a clean beach although there a few dogs wandering around.
Clean, like most places in Sri Lanka, it is not. But there is quite a lot of space and it's worth spending a few hours here :)

Moragalla beach is a beautiful place on earth! It is clean, so is the water. When the waves are huge, you can take a bath in a small lagoon in the corner of the beach. I`m a little walking disabeled and just love this lagoon. And the beach is not over crowded, Only a few local traders and not too many tourists. So you can have a walk and a bath in peace and harmony.

The beach itself is decent, but litter could be found here and there. Very strong currents, water is sometimes smelly and isn't as clean as on other beaches, as Bentota river falls into the ocean nearby. Many Ayurveda-hotels, therefore lots of pensioners - mainly from Germany, so the prices are just ridiculous.
dirty beach, too many people trying to sell you anything, not suitable for beaching , dirty green-ish water because of the river, not good

We had all experiences beach wise in Sri Lanka. Aluthgama beach was magnificent with wonderful big waves and very few people.  Moragalla beach is a bit busier but has very gentle waves and safe swimming perfect for out little grand child.  There are also a few beach side cafes where you can get a lounger and umbrella in return for a drink and a meal.
There is a few small restaurants along the beach but it isn’t much people. Lovely place to stress down and relax in the sun.

This beach is situated near the Cinnamon Bey hotel.  When we were there in October 2017, We just walked on the beach after sunrise as most of the beaches in the area had red flags which indicated they were not safe for swimming.

Because of the reef which is about 500 meters in the sea from the shore, the water is calm and ideal for swimming. Otherwise we found waters to be rough elsewhere and beyond the reef. It's right in front of the cinnamon bey hotel
The beach is beautiful, the ocean powerful, and sunset - absolutely stunning! I visited slightly off season, when the beach is said to be a bit narrow than usual - you will love it
Nice beach and bit safe as well. However always should obtain a advice before getting in. There are diving places where you may get all tide.

If you want quiet and unspoilt then this is it. Couple of beach bars, a few of the usual local traders, sand and sun. There's not much shade and unless very calm the sea is not good for children and poor swimmers. Some night life happens in the beach area. I heard fireworks and music a few times.

we had a great time on the beach as there is shade is not crowded so at some places it's really private and all to yourself. there are boat tours to the lighthouse and deep sea fishing which cost around $65 for the boat for around 4 hours

There is a beautiful coral reef. In the morning you can make it to the coral reef without any obstacle. But in the afternoon the ocean gets a bit rough. Identified so many sea creatures like Starfish, sea urchin, etc.
